page.title: 13Pocket money in 1985
page.content: 48 children aged 10 talked about the {amount}of pocket money they were given each.13 received less than Â£1.00 16 got between Â£1.00 & Â£1.50 8 got between Â£1.50 & Â£2.00 11 received Â£2.00 or more. Our teacher was surprised at how much money some children had. We then discussed how they{spent}it. Most children (42) saved money either in a bank or for something special.We mostly paid for subs at brownies and cubs (25p), and helped towards buying clothes (sandals Â£7.99, skirt Â£5.99, tee-shirt Â£2.50). Some children spent more than half their pocket money on sweets.July 1985 prices...mint chews 19p, peanuts 16p, chewing gum 10p, choc-ice 25p. Most children said their pocket money went up on their birthdays, and they had extra for Christmas.
